logicalComponents
Class HandEvent

java.lang.Object
  java.util.EventObject
      logicalComponents.HandEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class HandEvent
extends java.util.EventObject

The class which holds information about the changes in state of the Hand class. Whenever an event is fired by the Hand class, an instance of this class is passed to each HandChangeListener which is registered to receive it.

Author:
DMac
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

HandEvent

public HandEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                 JointName location,
                 double position,
                 int minPosition,
                 int maxPosition)
Creates a new instance that has information about a particular Joint which has changed state. Notice that with every change of state, both the min and max and position values are passed, so it is ambiguous to tell which values were modified.

Parameters:
source - The source of the event, in this case it is always from the Hand class
location - The location of this particular Joint which has changed state
position - The position of the Joint
minPosition - The minimum position of the Joint
maxPosition - The maximum position of the Joint
Method Detail

getJointName

public JointName getJointName()
Returns the JointName which refers to the Joint that changed state

Returns:
The JointName referencing which joint has changed state

getMaxPosition

public int getMaxPosition()
Returns the maximum position of the Joint which changed state

Returns:
the maximum position
See Also:
Joint

getMinPosition

public int getMinPosition()
Returns the minimum position of the Joint which changed state

Returns:
the minimum position

getPosition

public double getPosition()
Returns the value which would have returned by the Joint.getPosition method for the Joint that has changed state

Returns:
the position of the Joint relative to its min and max values
